text: Yea you're not kidding... Say I wanted to write a DSL or a language. So I parse, lex, etc the dsl syntax. Cool. Now is the point that I code gen whatever this language is: <https://mapping-high-level-constructs-to-llvm-ir.readthedocs.io/en/latest/basic-constructs/local-variables.html> . Which can compile down to machine instructions via LLVM?

text: Cool! Okay I think I get it now... Now the question is... Is it worth the fuss :stuck_out_tongue:. Nice to see a Julia example. All the tutorials in Java etc make it way scarier than it needs to be
